The spheres carrying Azureblade's form quickly disappear from sight,
transporting him to the searing eye and demesne of the Minions. At the
same time the remaining spheres continue to hover, searching the ground
for a long moment. Then with a dip a sphere recovered a small portion
of Animus, apparently the only remaining piece of his chest cavity.
Inside a small light blinks as his spark struggled to remain onlin.
Swiftly this too was transported back to the searing eye, awaiting the
will of Vorpal.

Preston
(Da'minion)




--- Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:

> As the sphere go away with the body, a small flicker of light
> carefully watches them go away. Certain that his body would not
> survive, Azureblade inverted his spark polarity so as to be
> undetectable and left its hulk. Of course, it could do nothing, but
> his mission had been a success. He proved the Minions they were as
> mortal as the rest of Transformers were.
> 
> Unhindered by gravity, the spark left the moon as soon as it safely
> could and went towards Earth at speeds only energy could manage.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...>
> wrote:
> >
> > 
> > --- Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:
> > 
> > > The body doesn't move.
> > 
> > The spheres paused for a moment as if scanning the inert form of
> > Azureblade. Then as if receiving commands from elsewhere they
> > reattached themselves to his form and began transporting him back
> in
> > the direction of the searing eye. In the meantime a few other
> spheres
> > hovered in the area, perhaps scanning for any remains of Animus.
> > 
> > Preston
> > (Da'minion)
> >
